list_definition.definition: to (cause to) move quickly, with a whirling or circling motion

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The leaves were swirled along the ground by the wind.

list_definition.definition: a whirling or circling motion or shape

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The dancers came on stage in a swirl of colour/color.

list_ex_of_english: A good deal of swirling occurred among the middling group, but there was little fundamental change or replacement by others.

Despite the upgrade, the storm was not well organized, with several smaller swirls rotating around a common cyclonic gyre.
She begins experiencing excruciating headaches and the room starts swirling around her.
There is a swirling jet fan near the plane.
